recipe_name: Spicy chorizo and cannellini bean stew
author: Tony Tobin
method: Heat a saucepan over a medium heat. Add the chorizo, onion and garlic and fry for 3-4 minutes, until the chorizo is golden brown all over. Add the remaining stew ingredients, except for the fresh herbs. Bring to the boil, then simmer for 10-12 minutes. Add the herbs and stir well. For the croutons, heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. When hot, add the puff pastry triangles and fry for 4-5 minutes, turning once, until crisp and golden all over.
ingredients: 70g/2½oz chorizo, sliced,  1 red onion, chopped,  1 garlic clove, crushed,  1 x 400g/14oz can cannellini beans, rinsed and drained,  3 tomatoes, chopped,  100ml/3½fl oz hot water,  1 tbsp tomato purée,  1 tbsp red wine vinegar,  1 tbsp fresh basil, chopped,  1 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped,  2 tbsp olive oil,  55g/2oz ready-made puff pastry, rolled out, cut into small triangles
